mitoscripts package¶

Submodules¶

mitoscripts.mitodata module¶

mitoscripts.mitodata.analyze_images(data_dir, name_dict=None, data_name='index')¶

Runs image analysis on each sample within a data directory

Parameters

  • data_dir (str) – path to where the data is.

  • name_dict (dict) – dict containing key:value pairs with keys of filename at time of acquisition and values of what they should be labeled (ex: KRAS_control: KRAS_ctrl)

  • data_name (str) – an optional name for your dataset, to designate that specific experiment (ex: compression_10_21_19)

Returns

pandas df containing a summary of all pertinent data

mitoscripts.mitodata.analyze_mitochondrial_length_distribution(data_dir, name_dict=None, data_name='index')¶

Runs image analysis on each sample within a data directory

Parameters

  • data_dir (str) – path to where the data is.

  • name_dict (dict) – dict containing key:value pairs with keys of filename at time of acquisition and values of what they should be labeled (ex: KRAS_control: KRAS_ctrl)

  • data_name (str) – an optional name for your dataset, to designate that specific experiment (ex: compression_10_21_19)

Returns

pandas df containing data pretaining to the distribution of mitochondria within the cell

mitoscripts.mitodata.append_conditions(sheet, name_dict, is_for_edgedist=False)¶

Add row “Conditions” describing the treatment of each image (+/- drug, +/- compression, etc)

Parameters

  • sheet (pandas df) – existing sheet with data on images from data_dir

  • name_dict (dict) –

    dict containing key:value pairs with keys of filename at time of acquisition and values of what they should be labeled

    (ex: KRAS_control: KRAS_ctrl, p53_aga: p53_aga) This will make anything labeled KRAS_control_001_041 etc named “KRAS_control”

  • is_for_edgelist (int) – this will be False unless set to true by proper function. Treats indices differently.

Returns

updated sheet with appended conditions column

Return type

sheet (pandas df)

mitoscripts.mitodata.create_automated_mitograph_df(mitograph_path)¶

Creates a cleanly-formatted df containing metrics that are automatic exports from the MitoGraph C code

Parameters

mitograph_path (str) – path to a .mitograph file

Returns

a cleanly-formatted df of MitoGraph automated outputs

Return type

df (pandas df)

mitoscripts.mitodata.create_degree_distribution_df(big_tuple)¶

Creates a degree distribution df for processing in the analyze_image() func

Parameters

big_tuple (tuple) –

containing: overall_network (igraph object): igraph object for a single image. Contains “length” data for each edge. edgelist_df (Pandas df): a pandas dataframe with the edgelist for the overall network combined_mito_dataframe (Pandas df): a pandas dataframe where every row is a single mitochondria in the overall

network and the columns describe how many nodes, edges, and how long the mitochondria is.

Returns

dataframe containing data on degree distributions of an image

Return type

degree_dist_df (pandas df)

mitoscripts.mitodata.create_edgelist_df(gnet_path)¶

Reads in a path to a .gnet file, produces a df of an edgelist for use in igraph

Parameters

gnet_path (str) – This must be a path to a .gnet file

Returns

This is an edgelist to be then processed by igraph to create a graph

theory representation of the mitochondria within that .gnet file’s image

Return type

df (pandas df)

mitoscripts.mitodata.decompose_individual_mitochondria(igraph_df_tuple)¶

Breaks down a whole-image igraph obj into its constituate mitochondria as separate igraph objs

Parameters

igraph_df_tuple (tuple) – a tuple from initialize_network() containing: overall_network (igraph object): igraph object for a single image. Contains “length” data for each edge. edgelist_df (Pandas df): a pandas dataframe with the edgelist for the overall network

Returns

a tuple containing:

overall_network (igraph object): igraph object for a single image. Contains “length” data for each edge.

edgelist_df (Pandas df): edgelist for the overall network

combined_mito_dataframe (Pandas df): a pandas dataframe where every row is a single mitochondria in the overall

network and the columns describe how many nodes, edges, and how long the mitochondria is

Return type

tuple

mitoscripts.mitodata.find_all_filetype(data_dir, extension)¶

Finds all files in a directory, returns their path

Parameters

  • data_dir (str) – path to where your MitoGraph output data are

  • extension (str) – the extension to search for (e.g. “.gnet”, “.mitograph”)

Returns

a list where each element is a string containing the path for desired files (with extension)

(e.g. path_list = [sample1.gnet, sample2.gnet])

Return type

path_list (list of strings)

mitoscripts.mitodata.initialize_network(gnet_path)¶

Creates a graph theory network of all mitochondria in an image.

Parameters

gnet_path (str) – path to a single gnet file, which contains connectivity data. One exists per image.

Returns

a tuple containing:

overall_network (igraph object): igraph object for a single image. Contains “length” data for each edge. edgelist_df (pandas df) the pandas df a pandas dataframe with the edgelist for the overall network

Return type

(tuple)

mitoscripts.mitodata.quant_graph_theory(data_dir)¶

Maps out the analysis for a data_dir of images

Parameters

data_dir (str) – path to where the data is

Returns

a transformation from image file -> per graph per mito analysis

Return type

map object

mitoscripts.mitodata.remove_enclosing_dirs(full_path)¶

Remove any directories in a filepath

If you pass a filename to this function, meaning it doesn’t contain the “/” string, it will simply return the input back to you.

Parameters

full_path (str) – a Unix-based path to a file (with extension)

Returns

just the filename (with extension) from the path

Return type

filename (string)

mitoscripts.mitodata.remove_extension(string)¶

Removes the extention from a string, as well as the directories.

This function may fail if more than one . is in the file, such as “.tar.gz”

Parameters

string – (string): either a path or a filename that for a specific file, with extension. (e.g. /usr/dir/sample.mitograph or sample.mitograph)

Returns

just the filename without the extension (e.g. “sample”)

Return type

filename_without_extension (str)

mitoscripts.mitodata.summarize_image(big_tuple)¶

Takes a big tuple filled with data about a specific image, then summarizes it into a single pandas df row

Parameters

big_tuple (tuple) –

containing: overall_network (igraph object): igraph object for a single image. Contains “length” data for each edge. edgelist_df (Pandas df): a pandas dataframe with the edgelist for the overall network combined_mito_dataframe (Pandas df): a pandas dataframe where every row is a single mitochondria in the overall

network and the columns describe how many nodes, edges, and how long the mitochondria is.

Returns

a single row to be concatonated later filled with metrics on a specific image

Return type

summary_dataframe (pandas df)

mitoscripts.mitodata.timefn(fn)¶

wrapper to time the enclosed function
